text: When your plans suddenly fall apart, what do you typically do first?

options.label: Quickly come up with a new plan and keep going
Take a moment to think about what really matters now
Get people together and start fixing things right away

text: A close friend calls you upset about something in their life. How do you usually respond?

options.label: Just listen and let them know they're not alone
Help them break down the problem into smaller pieces
Try to cheer them up or give them a fresh perspective

text: You have a completely free weekend with no obligations. What sounds most appealing?

options.label: Going somewhere I've never been before, even without much planning
Working on a creative project—art, music, writing, or building something
Doing something simple and relaxing that recharges me

text: When there's a disagreement between you and someone else, what's your first instinct?

options.label: Set clear boundaries and address it directly
Try to understand where the miscommunication happened
Use humor or kindness to ease the tension

text: When you're working on something creative (even just a work email or planning an event), you usually—

options.label: Follow my instincts and see where they take me
Organize my thoughts first and then fill in the details
Think about how it will make others feel

text: You're facing a big life decision (like changing jobs, moving, or ending a relationship). How do you approach it?

options.label: Go with what feels right in my gut, even if I can't fully explain it
Write out a plan, weigh the pros and cons carefully
Try a small version of the change first to see how it feels

text: After experiencing a setback or disappointment, you tend to—

options.label: Let go of what didn't work and start fresh
Reflect on what happened and what I can learn from it
Reconnect with what truly matters to me

text: When working on a team project, you often end up being—

options.label: The person who helps everyone stay organized and on track
The one who makes sure everyone feels heard and included
The person who suggests new approaches or directions

text: When do you feel most 'in the zone' or fully engaged?

options.label: When I'm solving a complex puzzle or learning something new
When I'm moving through experiences without too much structure
When I'm with people who just 'get' me

text: If you're picking a gift for someone important to you, you're most likely to choose—

options.label: Something that reminds them of a meaningful moment we shared
Something I made or customized specifically for them
A book, tool, or experience that helps them grow

text: When you witness something unfair or harmful happening to someone, you're most likely to—

options.label: Step in and do something about it immediately
Calmly explain why it's wrong and try to educate others
Focus on supporting the person who was harmed

text: At a social gathering with people you don't know well, you tend to—

options.label: Move between groups and introduce people to each other
Find one or two people and have deeper conversations
Hang back a bit and observe how people interact

text: When your daily routine starts to feel boring or draining, you usually—

options.label: Change something major—travel, take on a new project, or shake things up
Add more structure or efficiency to get my energy back
Strip away anything that doesn't feel essential

text: When people around you are arguing about something, you usually—

options.label: Focus everyone on the shared goal and move forward
Give everyone space to share, then summarize what's been said
Make a joke to release tension or reframe the situation

text: When you're under pressure and time is running out, you—

options.label: Cut through distractions and focus intensely on what needs to happen
Quickly find the most flexible path forward
Keep everyone calm and working together

text: What drives you most right now in your life?

options.label: Understanding myself and the world more deeply
Building meaningful relationships and connections
Having freedom and new experiences

text: When a situation is unclear and you don't have all the information, you tend to—

options.label: Explore and figure things out as I go
Create simple guidelines to help me stay grounded
Make sure everyone involved feels supported and included

text: When giving someone feedback or advice, you're usually—

options.label: Kind and encouraging, focusing on what they do well
Clear and honest about what needs to improve
Playful and insightful, pointing out things they might not see

text: After achieving something you've worked hard for, you usually—

options.label: Celebrate with the people who matter to me
Immediately start thinking about what's next
Use the momentum to create or build something meaningful

text: When a goal feels impossible or too far away, you—

options.label: Break it down and just focus on the next small step
Reimagine it in a way that feels more inspiring
Push myself harder and commit to making it happen

text: Which principle or value do you most strongly protect in your life?

options.label: Fairness and doing what's right
Loyalty and taking care of the people I love
Honesty and seeking the truth

text: How do you usually handle risk in your decisions?

options.label: I go for it when I have a strong vision, even if it's uncertain
I prefer to minimize risk with careful planning
I like to test things on a small scale first

text: When you're stressed or overwhelmed, you're more likely to—

options.label: Try to control more things to feel safe
Overthink and analyze everything
Reach out to someone I trust for support

text: In your closest relationships, what do you need most?

options.label: Deep emotional connection and vulnerability
Trust, consistency, and knowing we've got each other's backs
Space to grow individually while staying connected

text: If you could spend your ideal day doing exactly what you want, what would it involve?

options.label: Planning or organizing something meaningful
Making something with my hands or creativity
Being with people I care about and creating good memories

text: How would you describe your relationship with spirituality or life's bigger questions?

options.label: I think deeply about the meaning and purpose of everything
I feel it through beauty, gratitude, and simple moments
I'm drawn to synchronicity, intuition, and the mysterious

text: When someone criticizes you, your first reaction is usually to—

options.label: Figure out if it's valid and improve if needed
Talk about it to understand their perspective better
Make light of it or turn it into a learning moment

text: When someone crosses a personal boundary of yours, you—

options.label: Call it out directly and restate my limits
Try to understand why they did it before responding
Keep it light but stay aware of it going forward

text: In a community or group setting, what role do you naturally fall into?

options.label: The organizer who helps everyone stay focused
The connector who makes sure no one is left out
The thinker who helps everyone see the bigger picture

text: How do you typically approach making a major change in your life?

options.label: Let go of what isn't working and build something completely new
Imagine the future I want and work toward it step by step
Create routines and structure to make the change sustainable

text: When trying to get to the truth of something, you're most likely to—

options.label: Think it through logically and carefully
Test it out in real life and see what happens
Look at it from unexpected angles to see what's hidden

text: If you could leave behind one thing that would outlast you, it would be—

options.label: A community or relationships that continue to support each other
A vision or idea that inspires others to keep building
Creative work that continues to teach or move people
